website_summaries.verdict: Quirks aside, this manual lawn edger is priced to suit the budget-minded shopper, yet is strong enough to tackle most small to medium edging tasks.
pros: Has a flat, pointed blade made of heavy-gauge steel
Structure is uncomplicated, making the tool very easy to use and perfect for digging trenches around landscaping, sidewalks, and garden beds
Most affordable option on our shortlist
cons: Doesn't work well in very hard or clay-like soil
Has been known to break with repeated use
Customer service could be more attentive

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time using it.
customer_reviews.text: We used it one time and it broke on us. Would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Myers

customer_reviews.title: Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: 100% American made doesn't always mean it'll be a superior product. Gave this thing a shot on my yard but just isn't sitting well with me. Returning asap
customer_reviews.author: No.7

customer_reviews.title: Not Built for Clay Soil
customer_reviews.text: This edger should likely get the job done short term but this is not going to last long. Worked through about 10ft of Ohio clay soil and it is fairly bent up making it difficult to get a straight edge from here on out. Furthermore, because the head of the shovel is bent, it makes it difficult to initially dig in and start the next section without having to constantly finesse the shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. I used this tool to create ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. I used this tool to create a flower bed 110' long by 4' wide. I then used the tool to make the first edge into the yard then used it to cut up the sod into manageable pieces for removal. The tool held it's shape, did not bend and provided a clean edge.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Giunta

customer_reviews.title: This is solid enough to be used as a trenching ...
customer_reviews.text: This is solid enough to be used as a trenching tool. The blade is 6" long and perfectly flat. If you plan on trenching with a traditional shovel, you are straight tripping. Save yourself the labor, and buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful and handy
customer_reviews.text: We have people come mow the lawn. However, they do not trim the edge deep enough so we bought this handy tool. It's light and easy to use. We dig the edger along the side and push the soil from the sidewalk. It leaves a good distance. After next mow, the edge looks very nice. We like it that there is a stepping edge on the edger so you can step on it to dig deeper. We're happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Y Chen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool, will have to sharpen it though.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is actually pretty good, which I kinda didn't expect, although I wish they had put a sharped edge on it. After all, I'm trying to cut through tough grass, roots, and rocks that haven't been moved in decades. Still, I haven't broken it yet, which is a good thing. I stand on the small ledge above the blade and rock back and forth with it, and I don't notice any wiggling in the handle, so I have hopes for it lasting a while. The handles are comfy and the right height for me.
customer_reviews.author: jujubug

customer_reviews.title: From Beastly to diy Beauty
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a first time edger's dream. I was able to trench clay soil( with elbow grease) and did so without worry of equipment failure or breakage. I'm delighted that i probably saved money that can be spent on other projects
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable, but the price is right
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install an underground dog fence wire. The handles are too small and after 200 feet of installation the unit broke at the weld.
customer_reviews.author: Alise Frallicciardi

customer_reviews.title: Very well built, light in weight, but strong!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a durable edger that could handle this red clay, that seems to be everywhere! I also wanted a light, but yet strong post with the T-Handle and this accomplishes that too. Bottom line, this tool is very well made and definitely slices thru the sod and red clay very well!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Weber

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 65 FEET
customer_reviews.text: 65 feet! This junk tool lasted 65 feet. I EVEN USED MY edger first to make the line, then turned my sprinkler system on to soften the ground... AND IT BROKE AFTER 65 FEET!!!!! The pole is not thick. The weld was obviously a joke. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Tough, simple and exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this, if you're looking for an easy solution to overgrown edging. Like all such 'machines', they substitute muscle energy for electricity/gas power and such things do not coddle the lazy in yard maintenance. It can and will do the trick, but it takes effort. That said, it's a very robust tool and absolutely does the job for which it was built.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Dug a 100ft trench with it today. Package came quick, and u boxing it I noticed a chip in the blades edge. It was painted over letting me know the chip was not part of the shipping process. the product has very little weight to it leaving most of the force needed to go into the ground up to you. This wouldn't be a problem if the handles were so small on it. When applying a lot of force like standing in it I noticed the sjaft and head bend. And slamming the blade into the ground hurts because the handle profile is so small. This is not very thoughtfully designed.
customer_reviews.author: Slaten Cain Burney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect edger
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a flat blade shovel to edge the grass to the flower beds. Now I use nothing but the Bully tool edger. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I've been a landscaper for over 15 years. I've used lots of tools for edging beds. This one makes the job very easy and very consistent. A perfect 4 inch deep edge which will keep the grass from growing into the bed. Very well made. Keep it sharp and it will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Floyd

customer_reviews.title: just what I need it for. No problems here.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why the others had a problem with theirs, but my worked like a charm. I used it to bury an extension from the house to the pool. You can't even tell where we bury the cable. Back in the garage for the next job.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even think to buy
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality, unable to work with this tool. Even with soft soil it is generally impossible to dig. The tool bent in the first 5 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: A little short to really be useful
customer_reviews.text: This is ok for an occasional reshape but if you plan to use to create new beds its just too short. I dont mean the spade portion either. The actual "length of the tool" makes it uncomfortable to use regularly. Perhaps if i was 5'0...
customer_reviews.author: Mario & Michelle Barros

customer_reviews.title: Just use your shovel
customer_reviews.text: A regular shovel worked better than this tool. Kinda sad it took me so long to figure that out cause now I cant return it and I'm not going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: kmarshall45

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. I'm not sure how people are breaking these things. My guess is that they are using it like a shovel, which is NOT its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: If you break it, you’re doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I used this edger to create a trench for new sprinkler wire. It worked perfectly. I was able to bury wire at about 7-8” deep. This edger is built. The weld and the steel are strong. I see some reviews say they are breaking the edger, I say if you break it, you’re doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. Just remember if you have hard clay, it will bend. It's not the products, it's the soil.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rios

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it should be. Cuts great and weighted perfectly, just needed to be a tad taller handle. Still I am very happy with the tool!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Has to be sharpened. Blade was blunt. Handle seems light compared to the rest of the tool. Weld looks weak. Not near the quality of the loop hoe from the same people. USA made was the plus. I guess that I can weld it if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Was as described. Little harder to use than expected, but will manage.
customer_reviews.author: MelS

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done just fine. I had to put all of my body ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done just fine. I had to put all of my body weight and force on top to get it to dig into the ground. The weld held up greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Nich

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for edging. Perfect size for me and easy to use. There is a lot of clay in the ground so I had to wet the ground first. The tool could not dig into the hard ground when dry.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used to edge around some mulch beds. Seems very sturdy. Dug nicely. Easy to step on for added force.
customer_reviews.author: D. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: It came on time and work exactly as expected and it's one of those tools that makes you feel good because it has that personal groomed yard look!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hardridge

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Hi Bought this to bury wire for landscape lighting. it works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Billtcb

customer_reviews.title: How well this works.
customer_reviews.text: I jumped and jumped on this thing and it would not cut through the sod. I weigh 159lb. My husband weighs 240lb. It took the beating. It didn't bend or break.We got less than an 4th of an inch penitration into the sod.This was our first time trying a product like this. I know it would be some work...but yeah...no... I want my money back, so I can try another.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C Buege

customer_reviews.title: Shoulda got this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: For edging the yard to lay brick pavers. It goes down the perfect depth. Easy to push in. What took an hour before only took 20 mins wuth this edger
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Day

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband is actually the one who ordered this. He used it cutting out some grass. He likes the sharpness of the blade
customer_reviews.author: Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for because I can use my weight to cut the weeds before getting them off of the pavers!
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: This is great for light duty jobs.
customer_reviews.text: If the ground is soft. If not, spend the money and buy a heavy duty edger.
customer_reviews.author: Schlotthauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to burry low voltage/internet cable in grass field.
customer_reviews.text: Used this item to burry an internet cable about 300 feet in a grassy field. Worked perfectly. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Techie1234

customer_reviews.title: Dislike
customer_reviews.text: I find it hard to use .. a bit deep for the need. I got a red color different than what is in the picture. I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: K_Corn

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not hold up :(
customer_reviews.text: This product looks good out of the box, but began to bend almost immediately. I bought it because it appeared to be an all steel build, but that was not enough. I had to try to bend the “shovel” part of this tool back into place every few minutes to get the job done. It’s ok, not great.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Good for trenching
customer_reviews.text: Used this to dig a trench to install heavy landscape edging. It worked great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Fagan

customer_reviews.title: This is a tool that will last.
customer_reviews.text: I've broken at least 3 wooden edger tools. I finally got one that will last. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer A. Tycksen

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Steel is thick enough to resist bending while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Tawas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Made light work of making a trench for my garden edging. Very well made. Wish I had bought one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Alesha Casey

customer_reviews.title: I used it to bury radials for my ham radio antenna and it is heavy duty and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It saves my back. I used it to bury radials for my ham radio antenna and it is heavy duty and easy to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Wow Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So easy to edge with. Can cut in new flower beds with it too!
customer_reviews.author: Rhea M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in hard Midwestern clay
customer_reviews.text: It simply bounced off my clay dirt. I tried pushing in with my foot and nothing happened. If you have hard clay just use a shovel with a convex, pointed blade.
customer_reviews.author: Eat Run Read

customer_reviews.title: Handy for Sprinkler or cable work
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm, the ground was not supper hard though
customer_reviews.author: Denton

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than the old one I had but it’s seems like it’s heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Darling

customer_reviews.title: Great company.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my application but the product was solid and the customer service was top notch. USA. USA. USA.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use tool for edging your flower bed
customer_reviews.text: Leaves very straight edges. I used it for creating an edge for mulch border. Gives that clean border between your lawn and your mulch bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Melton

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but will not penetrated hard soil very easy. The blade is very dull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty tool
customer_reviews.text: Easily cut edge around trees. This made doing my borders so nice, easy pickup after. Thanks...
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Howard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use in soil filled with roots
customer_reviews.text: Works well for installing water line and electrical lines in my yard
customer_reviews.author: David S. Courington

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted, according to the description.
customer_reviews.author: DavidR

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help me create a trench in the soil. It has a solid and sharp edge to dig into the soil about 5 inches.
customer_reviews.author: J.B

customer_reviews.title: Worked As Well As The Most Espensive
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick, found it to be well made and strong. Did not bend, nor break!
customer_reviews.author: Mabel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Uniting used this to make indentations in garden for landscape edging.
customer_reviews.author: MSGIRL

customer_reviews.title: Works but easily bends
customer_reviews.text: The product worked but it is essentially a one time use tool. It bent very easily trenching around 100ft of St Augustine grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super tool
customer_reviews.text: excellent product! used this tool for placing wires underground. pushing this tool against my grass at my backyard was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s well made and will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor suggested the tool to me to create a sculptured edge in my garden. I received it fast and used it the day I got it. It’s very sturdy and exceeded my expectations. I’ll use it a lot. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Cardillo

customer_reviews.title: Does that it's made for
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Did bend a little at end of shaft. Great edge though.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Earl

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 1st day.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t even last one day. We used it for edging our landscaping and it broke before we finished the front of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Haley U.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I ran 400’ of invisible fence with this. Worked perfectly, and it can’t be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not to pry on it too much
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but seams like it not too sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy enough tool for digging low voltage wire trenches.
customer_reviews.text: I used this is very soft soil and it bent before I could finish digging a 50 Ft
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Hand Edger for the Money. Strength!
customer_reviews.text: Very Strong, Sturdy ready to last hand tool for everyday use, either Landscaper or experienced home owner will love this Hand Edger.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This broke at the weld the second time I used it. Poorly designed and engineered - the shaft needs to be elongated through the kick plate and anchored to the plate by a stronger weld and anchorred below the plate by a steel ring, at minimum
customer_reviews.author: cpu

product_meta.title: Bully Tools 92251 Round Lawn Edger with Steel T-Style Handle
product_meta.description:
The Bully Tools Round Lawn Edger features an all steel construction for extra durability. The 12 gauge steel blade easily penetrates the soil with a foot step and T-style handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Tools made to last a lifetime, and be passed on from generation to generation. 100% Made in the USA Bully Tools is bringing back that tradition with tools built to endure years of hard labor. We have re-engineered the classic designs of shovels, rakes and other popular tools to create more efficient, durable products. Special features on specific products include true 14 gauge steel, triple wall reinforced fiberglass handles, extended length ferrules, and welded I-beam supports. We stand behind our products and offer a limited lifetime warranty. If one of our tools fails during normal use, we will replace or refund it! In a time when cheap foreign products are the norm, Bully Tools offers affordable, high quality Made in the USA goods.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars215 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
